title: Monster starting inventory
data:
In *[NetHack](/wiki/NetHack "NetHack")*, certain types of [monsters](/wiki/Monster "Monster") may be created with objects in their starting inventory appropriate to their species - a **monster's starting inventory** may also contain a random [offensive item](/wiki/Offensive_item "Offensive item"), [miscellaneous item](/wiki/Miscellaneous_item "Miscellaneous item"), and/or [defensive item](/wiki/Defensive_item "Defensive item").

The [items](/wiki/Item "Item") that [spiders](/wiki/Spider "Spider") and [snakes](/wiki/Snake "Snake") are generated with during initial level creation are not part of their starting inventory, as they are created for the monsters to [hide](/wiki/Hide "Hide") under.

[ ]

## Contents

- [1 Description](#Description)

  - [1.1 Weapons](#Weapons)
  - [1.2 Armor](#Armor)
  - [1.3 Saddle](#Saddle)

- [2 Death drops](#Death_drops)

- [3 Strategy](#Strategy)

- [4 References](#References)

## Description

Monster starting inventory is distributed to each applicable monster at level creation, as well as each time a new monster is created.[\[1\]](#cite_note-1) Monsters generated in [bones](/wiki/Bones "Bones") files will have whatever inventory they were carrying at the time of its creation; monsters created by [reverse genocide](/wiki/Reverse_genocide "Reverse genocide") always have empty starting inventories.

A pretty comprehensive spoiler can be found [here](http://groups.google.com/group/rec.games.roguelike.nethack/msg/e34120648c374754).

### Weapons

A [humanoid](/wiki/Humanoid "Humanoid") monster that has a weapon attack, is not being placed on the [Rogue level](/wiki/Rogue_level "Rogue level"), and does not have any specific rules governing its starting inventory can be generated with one of the following five weapon sets, with an equal probability of each depending on whether it is [strong](/wiki/Strong "Strong"):[\[2\]](#cite_note-default-2)

| strong                                                        | not strong                                                             |
| ------------------------------------------------------------- | ---------------------------------------------------------------------- |
| [battle-axe](/wiki/Battle-axe "Battle-axe")                   | 3-14 [darts](/wiki/Dart "Dart")                                        |
| [two-handed sword](/wiki/Two-handed_sword "Two-handed sword") | [crossbow](/wiki/Crossbow "Crossbow"), 3-14 [bolts](/wiki/Bolt "Bolt") |
| [bow](/wiki/Bow "Bow"), 3-14 [arrows](/wiki/Arrow "Arrow")    |                                                                        |
| [long sword](/wiki/Long_sword "Long sword")                   | 3-5 [daggers](/wiki/Dagger "Dagger")                                   |
| [lucern hammer](/wiki/Lucern_hammer "Lucern hammer")          | [aklys](/wiki/Aklys "Aklys")                                           |

The probability of receiving any weapon is 514 - *N*, where *N* is the sum of: 2 if the monster is a [lord](/wiki/M2_LORD "M2 LORD"), 4 if it is a [prince](/wiki/M2_PRINCE "M2 PRINCE"), and 2 if it is [nasty](/wiki/M2_NASTY "M2 NASTY"). The final probabilities of the possible attribute combinations are:

|          | not nasty | nasty  |
| -------- | --------- | ------ |
| normal   | 35.71%    | 41.67% |
| lord     | 41.67%    | 50%    |
| overlord | 50%       | 62.5%  |

A user has suggested improving this page or section as follows:

*"List the species-specific rules for monster weapons. If this would be too long, maybe pare it down to the "important" ones."*

### Armor

In addition to any other items, monsters can also get armor, including [mercenaries](/wiki/Mercenaries "Mercenaries") in particular: members of the [Yendorian army](/wiki/Yendorian_army "Yendorian army"), [guards](/wiki/Guard "Guard"), [watchmen](/wiki/Watchmen "Watchmen"), [watch captains](/wiki/Watch_captain "Watch captain").

For mercenaries, armor items spawned are based on a complex mechanism to approximate the target AC of the given creature:

|                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                               |                                                                                                                                                                                         |                                                                                                                                                                                                           |
| ----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- | --------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- | --------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- |
| - ([crystal](/wiki/Crystal_plate_mail "Crystal plate mail")) [plate mail](/wiki/Plate_mail "Plate mail")
- [splint mail](/wiki/Splint_mail "Splint mail")
- [banded mail](/wiki/Banded_mail "Banded mail")
- [ring mail](/wiki/Ring_mail "Ring mail")
- ([studded)](/wiki/Studded_leather_armor "Studded leather armor") [leather armor](/wiki/Leather_armor "Leather armor") | * [helmet](/wiki/Helmet "Helmet")
* [dented pot](/wiki/Dented_pot "Dented pot")
* [small shield](/wiki/Small_shield "Small shield")
* [large shield](/wiki/Large_shield "Large shield") | - [low boots](/wiki/Low_boots "Low boots")
- [high boots](/wiki/High_boots "High boots")
- [leather gloves](/wiki/Leather_gloves "Leather gloves")
- [leather cloak](/wiki/Leather_cloak "Leather cloak") |

### Saddle

Ponies, horses, and warhorses have a 1% chance of being generated [saddled](/wiki/Saddle "Saddle").

## Death drops

- *Main article: [Death drop](/wiki/Death_drop "Death drop")*

Monsters killed by the player will drop their inventory, along with random objects that are generated upon their death. Some monsters also leave behind certain non-random body parts, such as [unicorn horns](/wiki/Unicorn_horn "Unicorn horn") or [dragon scales](/wiki/Dragon_scales "Dragon scales").

## Strategy

Monster starting inventory can provide valuable hints at the true [identities](/wiki/Identification "Identification") of objects with [randomized appearances](/wiki/Randomized_appearance "Randomized appearance").

## References

- [Makemon.c#line1017](/wiki/Makemon.c#line1017 "Makemon.c") a few special cases
- [Makemon.c#m\_initweap](/wiki/Makemon.c#m_initweap "Makemon.c") mostly weapons and elven items
- [Makemon.c#m\_initinv](/wiki/Makemon.c#m_initinv "Makemon.c") armor and most other objects
- [Muse.c#rnd\_defensive\_item](/wiki/Muse.c#rnd_defensive_item "Muse.c") magical [defensive item](/wiki/Defensive_item "Defensive item")
- [Muse.c#rnd\_misc\_item](/wiki/Muse.c#rnd_misc_item "Muse.c") magical "[misc item](/wiki/Misc_item "Misc item")"
- [Muse.c#rnd\_offensive\_item](/wiki/Muse.c#rnd_offensive_item "Muse.c") magical [offensive item](/wiki/Offensive_item "Offensive item")
- [Mplayer.c#mk\_mplayer](/wiki/Mplayer.c#mk_mplayer "Mplayer.c") player monsters

1. [↑](#cite_ref-1) [src/makemon.c in NetHack 3.6.7, line 576](https://github.com/NetHack/NetHack/blob/NetHack-3.6.7_Released/src/makemon.c#L576)
2. [↑](#cite_ref-default_2-0) [src/makemon.c in NetHack 3.6.7, line 512](https://github.com/NetHack/NetHack/blob/NetHack-3.6.7_Released/src/makemon.c#L512): *Default set of cases for monster weapon generation*

[![This article has been updated to reflect NetHack 3.6.7. Click here for more information.](/images/f/f7/Nh367-icon.png)](/wiki/NetHackWiki:Next_version "This article has been updated to reflect NetHack 3.6.7. Click here for more information.")
html:
Monster starting inventory

From NetHackWiki
Jump to navigation Jump to search

In NetHack, certain types of monsters may be created with objects in their starting inventory appropriate to their species - a monster's starting inventory may also contain a random offensive item, miscellaneous item, and/or defensive item.

The items that spiders and snakes are generated with during initial level creation are not part of their starting inventory, as they are created for the monsters to hide under.

Contents

  • 1 Description
    • 1.1 Weapons
    • 1.2 Armor
    • 1.3 Saddle
  • 2 Death drops
  • 3 Strategy
  • 4 References

Description

Monster starting inventory is distributed to each applicable monster at level creation, as well as each time a new monster is created.[1] Monsters generated in bones files will have whatever inventory they were carrying at the time of its creation; monsters created by reverse genocide always have empty starting inventories.

A pretty comprehensive spoiler can be found here.

Weapons

A humanoid monster that has a weapon attack, is not being placed on the Rogue level, and does not have any specific rules governing its starting inventory can be generated with one of the following five weapon sets, with an equal probability of each depending on whether it is strong:[2]

strong not strong
battle-axe 3-14 darts
two-handed sword crossbow, 3-14 bolts
bow, 3-14 arrows
long sword 3-5 daggers
lucern hammer aklys

The probability of receiving any weapon is 514 - N, where N is the sum of: 2 if the monster is a lord, 4 if it is a prince, and 2 if it is nasty. The final probabilities of the possible attribute combinations are:

not nasty nasty
normal 35.71% 41.67%
lord 41.67% 50%
overlord 50% 62.5%

A user has suggested improving this page or section as follows:

"List the species-specific rules for monster weapons. If this would be too long, maybe pare it down to the "important" ones."

Armor

In addition to any other items, monsters can also get armor, including mercenaries in particular: members of the Yendorian army, guards, watchmen, watch captains.

For mercenaries, armor items spawned are based on a complex mechanism to approximate the target AC of the given creature:

  • (crystal) plate mail
  • splint mail
  • banded mail
  • ring mail
  • (studded) leather armor
  • helmet
  • dented pot
  • small shield
  • large shield
  • low boots
  • high boots
  • leather gloves
  • leather cloak

Saddle

Ponies, horses, and warhorses have a 1% chance of being generated saddled.

Death drops

Main article: Death drop

Monsters killed by the player will drop their inventory, along with random objects that are generated upon their death. Some monsters also leave behind certain non-random body parts, such as unicorn horns or dragon scales.

Strategy

Monster starting inventory can provide valuable hints at the true identities of objects with randomized appearances.

References

  • Makemon.c#line1017 a few special cases
  • Makemon.c#m_initweap mostly weapons and elven items
  • Makemon.c#m_initinv armor and most other objects
  • Muse.c#rnd_defensive_item magical defensive item
  • Muse.c#rnd_misc_item magical "misc item"
  • Muse.c#rnd_offensive_item magical offensive item
  • Mplayer.c#mk_mplayer player monsters
  1. ↑ src/makemon.c in NetHack 3.6.7, line 576
  2. ↑ src/makemon.c in NetHack 3.6.7, line 512: Default set of cases for monster weapon generation
Retrieved from "https://nethackwiki.com/index.php?title=Monster_starting_inventory&oldid=175613"

rawPage:
In ''[[NetHack]]'', certain types of [[monster]]s may be created with objects in their starting inventory appropriate to their species - a '''monster's starting inventory''' may also contain a random [[offensive item]], [[miscellaneous item]], and/or [[defensive item]].

The [[item]]s that [[spider]]s and [[snake]]s are generated with during initial level creation are not part of their starting inventory, as they are created for the monsters to [[hide]] under.

==Description==
Monster starting inventory is distributed to each applicable monster at level creation, as well as each time a new monster is created.{{refsrc|src/makemon.c|576|version=NetHack 3.6.7}} Monsters generated in [[bones]] files will have whatever inventory they were carrying at the time of its creation; monsters created by [[reverse genocide]] always have empty starting inventories.

A pretty comprehensive spoiler can be found [http://groups.google.com/group/rec.games.roguelike.nethack/msg/e34120648c374754 here]. 

===Weapons===
A [[humanoid]] monster that has a weapon attack, is not being placed on the [[Rogue level]], and does not have any specific rules governing its starting inventory can be generated with one of the following five weapon sets, with an equal probability of each depending on whether it is [[strong]]:{{refsrc|src/makemon.c|512|version=NetHack 3.6.7|name="default"|comment=Default set of cases for monster weapon generation}}

{|class="wikitable"
!strong!!not strong
|-
|[[battle-axe]]||3-14 [[dart]]s
|-
|[[two-handed sword]]||[[crossbow]], 3-14 [[bolt]]s
|-
|colspan=2|[[bow]], 3-14 [[arrow]]s
|-
|[[long sword]]||3-5 [[dagger]]s
|-
|[[lucern hammer]]||[[aklys]]
|}

The probability of receiving any weapon is {{sfrac|5|14 - ''N''}}, where ''N'' is the sum of: 2 if the monster is a [[M2 LORD|lord]], 4 if it is a [[M2_PRINCE|prince]], and 2 if it is [[M2_NASTY|nasty]]. The final probabilities of the possible attribute combinations are:

{|class="wikitable"
!
!not nasty!!nasty
|-
!normal
|35.71%
|41.67%
|-
!lord
|41.67%
|50%
|-
!overlord
|50%
|62.5%
|}

{{todo|List the species-specific rules for monster weapons. If this would be too long, maybe pare it down to the "important" ones.}}

===Armor===
In addition to any other items, monsters can also get armor, including [[mercenaries]] in particular: members of the [[Yendorian army]], [[guard]]s, [[watchmen]], [[watch captain]]s.

For mercenaries, armor items spawned are based on a complex mechanism to approximate the target AC of the given creature:
{| border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="20"
|
* ([[Crystal plate mail|crystal]]) [[plate mail]]
* [[splint mail]]
* [[banded mail]]
* [[ring mail]]
* ([[Studded leather armor|studded)]] [[leather armor]]
|
* [[helmet]]
* [[dented pot]]
* [[small shield]]
* [[large shield]]
|
* [[low boots]]
* [[high boots]]
* [[leather gloves]]
* [[leather cloak]]
|}

===Saddle===
Ponies, horses, and warhorses have a 1% chance of being generated [[saddle]]d.

==Death drops==
{{main|Death drop}}
Monsters killed by the player will drop their inventory, along with random objects that are generated upon their death. Some monsters also leave behind certain non-random body parts, such as [[unicorn horn]]s or [[dragon scales]].

==Strategy==
Monster starting inventory can provide valuable hints at the true [[identification|identities]] of objects with [[randomized appearance]]s.

==References==
* [[Makemon.c#line1017]] a few special cases
* [[Makemon.c#m_initweap]] mostly weapons and elven items
* [[Makemon.c#m_initinv]] armor and most other objects
* [[Muse.c#rnd_defensive_item]] magical [[defensive item]]
* [[Muse.c#rnd_misc_item]] magical "[[misc item]]"
* [[Muse.c#rnd_offensive_item]] magical [[offensive item]]
* [[Mplayer.c#mk_mplayer]] player monsters
